verses.verse: (Is. 49:15) When my father and my mother forsake me, Then the LORD will take care of me.
(Ps. 25:4; 86:11; 119:33) Teach me Your way, O LORD, And lead me in a smooth path, because of my enemies.
Do not deliver me to the will of my adversaries; For (Deut. 19:18; Ps. 35:11; Matt. 26:60; Mark 14:56; John 19:33) false witnesses have risen against me, And such as breathe out violence.
I would have lost heart, unless I had believed That I would see the goodness of the LORD (Job 28:13; Ps. 52:5; 116:9; 142:5; Is. 38:11; Jer. 11:19; Ezek. 26:20) In the land of the living.
(Ps. 25:3; 37:34; 40:1; 62:5; 130:5; Prov. 20:22; Is. 25:9; (Hab. 2:3)) Wait on the LORD; Be of good courage, And He shall strengthen your heart; Wait, I say, on the LORD!
(Rejoicing in Answered Prayer) A Psalm of David. ([1]) To You I will cry, O LORD my Rock: Do not be silent to me, Lest, if You are silent to me, I become like those who go down to the pit.
Hear the voice of my supplications When I cry to You, (Ps. 5:7) When I lift up my hands (Ps. 138:2) toward Your holy sanctuary.
Do not take me away with the wicked And with the workers of iniquity, (Ps. 12:2; 55:21; 62:4; Jer. 9:8) Who speak peace to their neighbors, But evil is in their hearts.

((Ps. 62:12); 2 Tim. 4:14; (Rev. 18:6; 22:12)) Give them according to their deeds, And according to the wickedness of their endeavors; Give them according to the work of their hands; Render to them what they deserve.
Because (Is. 5:12) they do not regard the works of the LORD, Nor the operation of His hands, He shall destroy them And not build them up.
Blessed be the LORD, Because He has heard the voice of my supplications!
